remarks: Principle of Transfinite Recursion, part 3 of 3.  Theorem 7.41(3) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 47, with an additional condition on the recursion rule ` G ` ( as described at ~ tfri1 ).  Finally, we show that ` F ` is unique.  We do this by showing that any class ` B ` with the same properties of ` F ` that we showed in parts 1 and 2 is identical to ` F ` .  (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 4-May-2019.)
statement:
tfri3.1 $e |- F = recs ( G ) $.
tfri3.2 $e |- ( Fun G /\ ( G ` x ) e. _V ) $.
tfri3 $p |- ( ( B Fn On /\ A. x e. On ( B ` x ) = ( G ` ( B |` x ) ) ) -> B = F ) $.
$d B x $.
$d F x $.
$d G x $.
